history.proof: intros H. apply is_sup_seq_le with (u := u) (v := v). - apply H. - apply Sup_seq_correct. - apply Sup_seq_correct.

chat.content:
Help me to prove a theorem in Coq, based on provided proof states including hypotheses and goals. Give a complete proof in only one single code block without explanations, extra definitions. Give a complete proof in one response, only give the proof body, without repeating the definition and "Proof.". Avoid existing names when using intros. Write the commands separately, without ";" and "[cmd|cmd]". Use bullets for structure, NEVER use "{" and "}". When -, + and * are used out, proceed to double versions like --, ++, etc. For example, given proof state:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m
============================
m + S n = S n + m
The hypotheses n, m: nat and IHn: m + n = n + m are given first, then the goal, m + S n = S n + m, separated by =. Expect a response like: 
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.``` 
You do not intros any terms because all terms have already been introduced.

When I give:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m
============================
n, m: nat
your answer should be like:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```
Definitions and lemmas related to the proof will be provided, use them accordingly.


Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
v: nat -> Rbar
u: nat -> Rbar

Goal:
(forall n : nat, Rbar_le (u n) (v n)) -> Rbar_le (Sup_seq u) (Sup_seq v)

Premises:
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat For S: Argument scope is [nat_scope]
Rbar_le = fun x y : Rbar => match x with | Finite x0 => match y with | Finite y0 => x0 <= y0 | p_infty => True | m_infty => False end | p_infty => match y with | p_infty => True | _ => False end | m_infty => True end : Rbar -> Rbar -> Prop
Sup_seq = fun u : nat -> Rbar => proj1_sig (ex_sup_seq u) : (nat -> Rbar) -> Rbar Argument scope is [function_scope]
is_inf_seq_le : forall (u v : nat -> Rbar) (l1 l2 : Rbar), (forall n : nat, Rbar_le (u n) (v n)) -> is_inf_seq u l1 -> is_inf_seq v l2 -> Rbar_le l1 l2
is_sup_seq_le : forall (u v : nat -> Rbar) (l1 l2 : Rbar), (forall n : nat, Rbar_le (u n) (v n)) -> is_sup_seq u l1 -> is_sup_seq v l2 -> Rbar_le l1 l2
Sup_seq_scal_l : forall (a : R) (u : nat -> Rbar), 0 <= a -> Sup_seq (fun n : nat => Rbar_mult a (u n)) = Rbar_mult a (Sup_seq u)
Sup_seq_correct : forall u : nat -> Rbar, is_sup_seq u (Sup_seq u)
Inf_opp_sup : forall u : nat -> Rbar, Inf_seq u = Rbar_opp (Sup_seq (fun n : nat => Rbar_opp (u n)))
LPO_notforall : forall P : nat -> Prop, (forall n : nat, P n \/ ~ P n) -> ~ (forall n : nat, ~ P n) -> exists n : nat, P n
is_sup_seq = fun (u : nat -> Rbar) (l : Rbar) => match l with | Finite l0 => forall eps : posreal, (forall n : nat, Rbar_lt (u n) (l0 + eps)) /\ (exists n : nat, Rbar_lt (l0 - eps) (u n)) | p_infty => forall M : R, exists n : nat, Rbar_lt M (u n) | m_infty => forall (M : R) (n : nat), Rbar_lt (u n) M end : (nat -> Rbar) -> Rbar -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope _]
is_inf_seq = fun (u : nat -> Rbar) (l : Rbar) => match l with | Finite l0 => forall eps : posreal, (forall n : nat, Rbar_lt (l0 - eps) (u n)) /\ (exists n : nat, Rbar_lt (u n) (l0 + eps)) | p_infty => forall (M : R) (n : nat), Rbar_lt M (u n) | m_infty => forall M : R, exists n : nat, Rbar_lt (u n) M end : (nat -> Rbar) -> Rbar -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope _]
Inf_seq_scal_l : forall (a : R) (u : nat -> Rbar), 0 <= a -> Inf_seq (fun n : nat => Rbar_mult a (u n)) = Rbar_mult a (Inf_seq u)
is_sup_seq_ext : forall (u v : nat -> Rbar) (l : Rbar), (forall n : nat, u n = v n) -> is_sup_seq u l -> is_sup_seq v l
is_inf_seq_ext : forall (u v : nat -> Rbar) (l : Rbar), (forall n : nat, u n = v n) -> is_inf_seq u l -> is_inf_seq v l
LPO : forall P : nat -> Prop, (forall n : nat, P n \/ ~ P n) -> {n : nat | P n} + {forall n : nat, ~ P n}
Inf_seq_ext : forall u v : nat -> Rbar, (forall n : nat, u n = v n) -> Inf_seq u = Inf_seq v
Sup_seq_ext : forall u v : nat -> Rbar, (forall n : nat, u n = v n) -> Sup_seq u = Sup_seq v
Rbar_is_glb_inf_seq : forall (u : nat -> Rbar) (l : Rbar), Rbar_is_glb (fun x : Rbar => exists n : nat, x = u n) l -> is_inf_seq u l
is_sup_seq_lub : forall (u : nat -> Rbar) (l : Rbar), is_sup_seq u l -> Rbar_is_lub (fun x : Rbar => exists n : nat, x = u n) l
is_inf_seq_glb : forall (u : nat -> Rbar) (l : Rbar), is_inf_seq u l -> Rbar_is_glb (fun x : Rbar => exists n : nat, x = u n) l
Rbar_is_lub_sup_seq : forall (u : nat -> Rbar) (l : Rbar), Rbar_is_lub (fun x : Rbar => exists n : nat, x = u n) l -> is_sup_seq u l
is_inf_opp_sup_seq : forall (u : nat -> Rbar) (l : Rbar), is_inf_seq (fun n : nat => Rbar_opp (u n)) (Rbar_opp l) < -> is_sup_seq u l
is_sup_opp_inf_seq : forall (u : nat -> Rbar) (l : Rbar), is_sup_seq (fun n : nat => Rbar_opp (u n)) (Rbar_opp l) < -> is_inf_seq u l
Rbar_sup_eq_lub : forall u : nat -> Rbar, Sup_seq u = Rbar_lub (fun x : Rbar => exists n : nat, x = u n)
Inf_eq_glb : forall u : nat -> Rbar, Inf_seq u = Rbar_glb (fun x : Rbar => exists n : nat, x = u n)
eventually = fun P : nat -> Prop => exists N : nat, forall n : nat, (N <= n)%nat -> P n : (nat -> Prop) -> Prop Argument scope is [function_scope]
Sup_opp_inf : forall u : nat -> Rbar, Sup_seq u = Rbar_opp (Inf_seq (fun n : nat => Rbar_opp (u n)))
Inf_seq_correct : forall u : nat -> Rbar, is_inf_seq u (Inf_seq u)
Rbar_lub_subset : forall E1 E2 : Rbar -> Prop, (forall x : Rbar, E1 x -> E2 x) -> Rbar_le (Rbar_lub E1) (Rbar_lub E2)
Rbar_glb_subset : forall E1 E2 : Rbar -> Prop, (forall x : Rbar, E2 x -> E1 x) -> Rbar_le (Rbar_glb E1) (Rbar_glb E2)
Rbar_le_trans : forall x y z : Rbar, Rbar_le x y -> Rbar_le y z -> Rbar_le x z
S_INR : forall n : nat, INR (S n) = INR n + 1
Inf_seq = fun u : nat -> Rbar => proj1_sig (ex_inf_seq u) : (nat -> Rbar) -> Rbar Argument scope is [function_scope]

```coq
intros H.
apply is_sup_seq_le with (u := u) (v := v).
- apply H.
- apply Sup_seq_correct.
- apply Sup_seq_correct.
Qed.
```
